title: 115_hr3192
content: The "CHIP Mental Health Parity Act" ensures access to mental health and substance use disorder services for children and pregnant women under the Children's Health Insurance Program. The "CHIP Mental Health Parity Act" expands coverage to include mental health and substance use disorder services for children and pregnant women under the Children's Health Insurance Program. The CHIP Mental Health Parity Act expands coverage under the Children's Health Insurance Program to include mental health services for children and pregnant women, delivered in a culturally and linguistically appropriate manner. The CHIP Mental Health Parity Act expands coverage under the Children's Health Insurance Program to include mental health services for children and pregnant women, delivered in a culturally and linguistically appropriate manner. Amendments are made to various sections of the Social Security Act to replace "substance abuse" with "substance use" and update subsection references. The CHIP Mental Health Parity Act expands coverage under the Children's Health Insurance Program to include mental health services for children and pregnant women. Amendments are made to ensure compliance with the Public Health Service Act for financial requirements and treatment limitations related to mental health and substance use disorder services. The amendments made by this section will take effect with respect to child health assistance provided one year after the enactment of the Act, except for State child health plans that require legislation to comply with the new requirements. States have until the first day of the first calendar quarter after the close of the first regular session of the State legislature to meet additional requirements. Passed the House of Representatives on June 19, 2018, attested by Karen L. Haas, Clerk.
